intro: Argostemma hallieri var. sparsipilum, commonly known as the sparsely hairy argostemma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in damp, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
